channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Causal Responsibility Attribution for Human-AI Collaboration
item.description: As Artificial Intelligence (AI) systems increasingly influence decision-making across various fields, the need to attribute responsibility for undesirable outcomes has become essential, though complicated by the complex interplay between humans and AI.

item.title: Leveraging Large Language Models in Code Question Answering: Baselines and Issues
item.description: This paper presents a work devoted to using large language models for question answering over source code in Python.

item.title: LiVOS: Light Video Object Segmentation with Gated Linear Matching
item.description: Semi-supervised video object segmentation (VOS) has been largely driven by space-time memory (STM) networks, which store past frame features in a spatiotemporal memory to segment the current frame via softmax attention.

item.title: SUDS: A Strategy for Unsupervised Drift Sampling
item.description: We also introduce the Harmonized Annotated Data Accuracy Metric (HADAM), a metric that evaluates classifier performance in relation to the quantity of annotated data required to achieve the stated performance, thereby taking into account the difficulty of acquiring labeled data.

item.title: DDFAV: Remote Sensing Large Vision Language Models Dataset and Evaluation Benchmark
item.description: Next, a training instruction set is produced based on some high-quality remote sensing images selected from the proposed dataset.

item.title: Compositional simulation-based inference for time series
item.description: Amortized simulation-based inference (SBI) methods train neural networks on simulated data to perform Bayesian inference.

item.title: Your copula is a classifier in disguise: classification-based copula density estimation
item.description: We propose reinterpreting copula density estimation as a discriminative task.

item.title: Query-Efficient Adversarial Attack Against Vertical Federated Graph Learning
item.description: As a result, the shadow model can improve the attack success rate of various centralized attacks with a few queries.

item.title: Adversarial multi-task underwater acoustic target recognition: towards robustness against various influential factors
item.description: While significant efforts have been dedicated to addressing these influential factors in other domains of underwater acoustics, they are often neglected in the field of underwater acoustic target recognition.

item.title: Specialized Foundation Models Struggle to Beat Supervised Baselines
item.description: Following its success for vision and text, the "foundation model" (FM) paradigm -- pretraining large models on massive data, then fine-tuning on target tasks -- has rapidly expanded to domains in the sciences, engineering, healthcare, and beyond.

item.title: Rethinking Decoders for Transformer-based Semantic Segmentation: Compression is All You Need
item.description: State-of-the-art methods for Transformer-based semantic segmentation typically adopt Transformer decoders that are used to extract additional embeddings from image embeddings via cross-attention, refine either or both types of embeddings via self-attention, and project image embeddings onto the additional embeddings via dot-product.

item.title: Real-Time Text Detection with Similar Mask in Traffic, Industrial, and Natural Scenes
item.description: In addition, to validate the scene robustness of the SM-Net, we conduct experiments on traffic, industrial, and natural scene datasets.

item.title: Conditional Vendi Score: An Information-Theoretic Approach to Diversity Evaluation of Prompt-based Generative Models
item.description: We introduce the \emph{Conditional-Vendi} score based on $H(X|T)$ to quantify the internal diversity of the model and the \emph{Information-Vendi} score based on $I(X; T)$ to measure the statistical relevance between the generated data and text prompts.

item.title: Label Critic: Design Data Before Models
item.description: Label Critic can also check the label quality of a single AI Label with 71. 8% accuracy when no alternatives are available for comparison, prompting radiologists to review and edit if the estimated quality is low (19% depending on body structures).

item.title: Evaluating Machine Learning Models against Clinical Protocols for Enhanced Interpretability and Continuity of Care
item.description: Accordingly, in this article, we first propose metrics to assess the accuracy of ML models with respect to the established protocol.

item.title: SMoA: Improving Multi-agent Large Language Models with Sparse Mixture-of-Agents
item.description: While multi-agent systems have been shown to significantly enhance the performance of Large Language Models (LLMs) across various tasks and applications, the dense interaction between scaling agents potentially hampers their efficiency and diversity.

item.title: Layer-Adaptive State Pruning for Deep State Space Models
item.description: In this work, we provide a structured pruning method for SSMs, Layer-Adaptive STate pruning (LAST), which reduces the state dimension of each layer in minimizing model-level energy loss by extending modal truncation for a single system.

item.title: ADOPT: Modified Adam Can Converge with Any $β_2$ with the Optimal Rate
item.description: Adam is one of the most popular optimization algorithms in deep learning.

item.title: Correlation of Object Detection Performance with Visual Saliency and Depth Estimation
item.description: As object detection techniques continue to evolve, understanding their relationships with complementary visual tasks becomes crucial for optimising model architectures and computational resources.

item.title: Online Data Collection for Efficient Semiparametric Inference
item.description: We present two online data collection policies, Explore-then-Commit and Explore-then-Greedy, that use the parameter estimates at a given time to optimally allocate the remaining budget in the future steps.

item.title: Game Plot Design with an LLM-powered Assistant: An Empirical Study with Game Designers
item.description: We introduce GamePlot, an LLM-powered assistant that supports game designers in crafting immersive narratives for turn-based games, and allows them to test these games through a collaborative game play and refine the plot throughout the process.

item.title: Automatic doubly robust inference for linear functionals via calibrated debiased machine learning
item.description: For learning such estimands, in this work, we propose novel debiased machine learning estimators that are doubly robust asymptotically linear, thus providing not only doubly robust consistency but also facilitating doubly robust inference (e. g., confidence intervals and hypothesis tests).

item.title: Dissecting the Failure of Invariant Learning on Graphs
item.description: Enhancing node-level Out-Of-Distribution (OOD) generalization on graphs remains a crucial area of research.

item.title: A Deep-Based Approach for Multi-Descriptor Feature Extraction: Applications on SAR Image Registration
item.description: To address the challenges of SAR images, we utilize the R2D2 network and propose a training scheme specifically tailored for these images.

item.title: Textual Aesthetics in Large Language Models
item.description: Image aesthetics is a crucial metric in the field of image generation.

item.title: Test-Time Dynamic Image Fusion
item.description: The decomposed components represent the effective information from the source data, thus the gap between them reflects the Relative Dominability (RD) of the uni-source data in constructing the fusion image.

item.title: V-DPO: Mitigating Hallucination in Large Vision Language Models via Vision-Guided Direct Preference Optimization
item.description: Recent research indicates that the over-reliance on the Large Language Model (LLM) backbone, as one cause of the LVLM hallucination, inherently introduces bias from language priors, leading to insufficient context attention to the visual inputs.

item.title: Lost in Context: The Influence of Context on Feature Attribution Methods for Object Recognition
item.description: This study investigates how context manipulation influences both model accuracy and feature attribution, providing insights into the reliance of object recognition models on contextual information as understood through the lens of feature attribution methods.

item.title: The Unreasonable Effectiveness of LLMs for Query Optimization
item.description: Recent work in database query optimization has used complex machine learning strategies, such as customized reinforcement learning schemes.

item.title: Membership Inference Attacks against Large Vision-Language Models
item.description: Large vision-language models (VLLMs) exhibit promising capabilities for processing multi-modal tasks across various application scenarios.

item.title: Grounding Natural Language to SQL Translation with Data-Based Self-Explanations
item.description: Natural Language Interfaces for Databases empower non-technical users to interact with data using natural language (NL).

item.title: Inference Optimal VLMs Need Only One Visual Token but Larger Models
item.description: Our results reveal a surprising trend: for visual reasoning tasks, the inference-optimal behavior in VLMs, i. e., minimum downstream error at any given fixed inference compute, is achieved when using the largest LLM that fits within the inference budget while minimizing visual token count - often to a single token.

item.title: Privacy-Preserving Graph-Based Machine Learning with Fully Homomorphic Encryption for Collaborative Anti-Money Laundering
item.description: Combating money laundering has become increasingly complex with the rise of cybercrime and digitalization of financial transactions.

item.title: Sparse Reconstruction of Wavefronts using an Over-Complete Phase Dictionary
item.description: The Zernike basis efficiently represents common optical aberrations but struggles with complex or non-standard wavefronts such as optical vortices, Bessel beams, or wavefronts with sharp discontinuities.

item.title: A Machine Learning Approach for the Efficient Estimation of Ground-Level Air Temperature in Urban Areas
item.description: Based on the obtained results, deep neural networks are confirmed to be faster and less computationally expensive alternative for ground-level air temperature compared to numerical models.

item.title: Confidence Calibration of Classifiers with Many Classes
item.description: For classification models based on neural networks, the maximum predicted class probability is often used as a confidence score.

item.title: DA-MoE: Addressing Depth-Sensitivity in Graph-Level Analysis through Mixture of Experts
item.description: Empirically, fewer layers are sufficient for message passing in smaller graphs, while larger graphs typically require deeper networks to capture long-range dependencies and global features.

item.title: Unleashing the power of novel conditional generative approaches for new materials discovery
item.description: For a very long time, computational approaches to the design of new materials have relied on an iterative process of finding a candidate material and modeling its properties.

item.title: Time-Causal VAE: Robust Financial Time Series Generator
item.description: We build a time-causal variational autoencoder (TC-VAE) for robust generation of financial time series data.

item.title: Classification Done Right for Vision-Language Pre-Training
item.description: Due to the absence of the text encoding as contrastive target, SuperClass does not require a text encoder and does not need to maintain a large batch size as CLIP does.

item.title: HtmlRAG: HTML is Better Than Plain Text for Modeling Retrieved Knowledge in RAG Systems
item.description: To alleviate this problem, we propose HtmlRAG, which uses HTML instead of plain text as the format of retrieved knowledge in RAG.

item.title: Correlating Variational Autoencoders Natively For Multi-View Imputation
item.description: A multi-view VAE approach is proposed that incorporates a joint prior with a non-zero correlation structure between the latent spaces of the VAEs.

item.title: Continual Audio-Visual Sound Separation
item.description: The task is inherently challenging as our models must not only effectively utilize information from both modalities in current tasks but also preserve their cross-modal association in old tasks to mitigate catastrophic forgetting during audio-visual continual learning.

item.title: On the loss of context-awareness in general instruction fine-tuning
item.description: We are the first to identify and show that the loss of context-awareness appears on instruction-finetuned LLMs when the chat template is applied to the input prompts.

item.title: WebRL: Training LLM Web Agents via Self-Evolving Online Curriculum Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Specifically, WebRL incorporates 1) a self-evolving curriculum that generates new tasks from unsuccessful attempts, 2) a robust outcome-supervised reward model (ORM), and 3) adaptive reinforcement learning strategies to ensure consistent improvements.

item.title: Training on the Test Model: Contamination in Ranking Distillation
item.description: By simulating a ``worst-case'' setting where the degree of contamination is known, we find that contamination occurs even when the test data represents a small fraction of the teacher's training samples.

item.title: Divergent Domains, Convergent Grading: Enhancing Generalization in Diabetic Retinopathy Grading
item.description: This approach ensures that our DG model remains robust against early susceptibility to label noise, even when only a limited dataset of non-DR fundus images is available for pretraining.

item.title: Fair In-Context Learning via Latent Concept Variables
item.description: However, with increasing applications in high-stakes domains, it has been shown that LLMs can inherit social bias and discrimination from their pre-training data.

item.title: Optimal Classification under Performative Distribution Shift
item.description: Performative learning addresses the increasingly pervasive situations in which algorithmic decisions may induce changes in the data distribution as a consequence of their public deployment.

item.title: MeToken: Uniform Micro-environment Token Boosts Post-Translational Modification Prediction
item.description: Post-translational modifications (PTMs) profoundly expand the complexity and functionality of the proteome, regulating protein attributes and interactions that are crucial for biological processes.
